Other Information.Additional Info: Adsorption occurs on the surface and inside the pore.
Adsorption occurs only on the surface due to size exclusion.

Sieving Mechanism: Pore sieving effect determines that RhB adsorption is restricted to the surface while FS can adsorb both on the surface and inside the pores.

Experimental Validation.Method: Batch adsorption experiments, UV–Vis spectroscopy, chromatographic column simulation
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Maximum adsorption capacity for fluorescein sodium: 480.2 mg g⁻¹; Separation factor (SFS/RhB): up to 25.1

Other Information.Additional Info: The material exhibits good anti-interference ability from solution pH (3.5–8.5) and can be regenerated via acid washing.
